basics.name: Hunter Broughton
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.x_title: Hello! I'm Hunter Broughton, glad you're here!
basics.summary:
I'm a junior studying Computer Science and Economics at the University of Michigan. Last summer I was a front-end engineering intern for Vloggi, a tech startup in Sydney, Australia. I made this website to highlight my past work, courses, projects, and much more! Here are some of my skills and personal interests:

  • Front-End Web Development
  • Algorithm Design and Analysis
  • Back-End Data Management and Machine Learning

work.summary: GreekLink is a social media platform for fraternities and sororities. I am responsible for the front-end development of the website and our marketing efforts.

Developed and optimized web interfaces using ReactJS, integrated scalable features and configurable UI components, and streamlined media management on the Vloggi platform, while optimizing data flow with a MySQL backend using Node.js.

Manage operations for a 120-member fraternity, administer a $180,000 annual budget, collaborate with national headquarters and the Michigan Interfraternity Council, and spearhead initiatives to boost member engagement and community outreach.
Administered clinics and travel teams, coached over 300 players, managed logistics for summer camps, marketed to families via social media, and managed a $7,000 annual budget for Classics Lacrosse.
Member of the Project Spark Software Team, using Python to transfor bike diagnostic data to a driver-friendly format displayed on the screen.
Developed 20 online fundraisers raising over $5000, conducted surveys, advocated for funding, and created educational lesson plans to fight human trafficking and bolster education in Nigeria.
